intro: Justicia setibractea, commonly known as the velvetleaf justicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses in tropical and subtropical areas.
